abstract: Newspaper comic strips continue to be prominent in culture; King Features Syndicate is noting its 100th anniversary by running 16-page insert of classic comics in hundreds of newspapers; organization runs syndicated strips by 65 cartoonists in more than 2,800 papers in 72 countries.
lead_paragraph: A 16-page insert in hundreds of newspapers next week celebrates the 100th anniversary of King Features Syndicate, which distributes features like Blondie, which started in 1930, and Beetle Bailey, 1950.

headline.main: Classic Comic Strips Will Return to Newspapers in Special Insert
headline.print_headline: Comics, Classic and Newer, Make a Comeback

snippet: A 16-page insert in hundreds of newspapers next week celebrates the 100th anniversary of King Features Syndicate, which distributes features like Blondie, which started in 1930, and Beetle Bailey, 1950.
